title: Fredericksburg & Spotsylvania National Military Park: Germanna Ford
body: Germanna Ford        After three Union corps crossed the Rappahannock River at Kelly's Ford on April 28, the Eleventh and Twelfth Corps marched to the Rapidan River at Germanna Ford where they crossed on the afternoon and evening of April 29. The Fifth Corps proceeded  to the Rapidan River at Ely's Ford. The three corps reunited at Chancellorsville on the afternoon of April 30. This photo shows the Union army crossing the Rapidan River at Germanna Ford a year later during the Wilderness Campaign.         This modern photo shows the Rapidan River at Germanna Ford.          Portrait of General Ulysses S. Grant   Proceed to virtual tour stop, Bullock House Site.
